page.title: 04HOUSING - IGHTHAM SQUARE
page.content: In Ightham Square there is a War Memorial, and on it are these words:{ {To the glorious memory of the Ightham {men who laid down their lives in the {great wars of 1914-1918 and 1939-1945. { } There are some buildings in Ightham Square which have been there for a very long time.{One of the old- {est buildings is used by a private {coach company as a garage for their {coaches.}Before that the building was an Inn called{The Railway Inn. }At the back there used to be forge. There is an Art Gallery in the Square which is a stone and brick house with a slate roof, whilst most of the buildings are Tudor, half timbered construction. They are also listed buildings. There are two 'pubs' in the Square; {The Chequers}and {The George {and Dragon.}The Chequers was built because The George and Dragon had so
